Dating: 21ST DYNASTY (not before); 21ST DYNASTY ?; 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after)
Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; FAYENCE; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Shabti of Iouapout (?)
Description: This funerary statuette in blue faience was discovered at Abydos during the excavations of J. Garstang in 1908-1909. The name of the owner probably reads "Iouapout". The frontal band tied behind the head could indicate that the statuette dates from the 21st Dynasty or from the 22nd Dynasty.
